author: siladu
content:
Which fork details do you expect should be returned for current/next/last when there's only the genesis block available?

Client implementation quirks aside, this case is a little weird because the forks were activated on block number before switching to timestamp at shanghai, so for holesky, paris is the latest block 0 fork when the node is also on block 0.
So, my strict interpretation for holesky is that
`current` should be `paris`
`next` should be `shanghai` 
`last` should be `bpo2`
which I _think_ is what nethermind and geth are showing.

This will be different for other testnets because e.g. sepolia started at `london`, hoodi at `cancun`; mainnet will always be `frontier`.

However, isn't that useless for what you're trying to test?
We want `next` to be bpo1 at this point in time don't we? - or are you only interested in `last`?

I disagreed at the time but starting to think listing all forks might be a better approach afterall to take the time element out of it.

author: siladu
content: I was thinking along the lines of human readability rather than automation tbf
